reviews.text: This cat cafe has separated "meeting room" for the cats, you can have your coffee after your appointment with the furballs. The cats are very trusting and will flock the visitors for cuddles and goodies.
Super good place! The cats are adorable and they're so clingy! Best cat cafe ever! But its a lil bit expensive cause 1500¥ excluding drink
Great cat cafe part
The cats are really playful and it was fun!
Good place very relax

reviews.text: The cats seem chilled out and friendly, the staff were helpful and it's not too hard to get to.
Super cute kittens, you pay like $10 to play with them for an hour
Nice cat cafe. 5 minute walk from Osaka Station.  Good place to relax in the busy Osaka.

梅田に唯一あると言う猫カフェへ
猫が大好きで猫カフェめぐりをよくしていますが
2度ときたくないと初めて思った猫カフェです。

店内は不清潔 匂いも最悪でした。
そして ほとんどの猫ちゃんが風邪をひいており
正直 一緒に居たくない。と思いました。
お店はお休みして猫ちゃんの体調を最優先にすべきだと思います。
お客様の為にも、可愛い猫ちゃんの為にも。
とても残念でした。

入りやすく、とっても居心地のいい空間です。
あいくるしいねこちゃんたちと、おだやかなステキな時間を過ごすことができます。

オーナー様も、とてもお優しい雰囲気の方です。
ねこちゃんたちへの愛情が、いっぱい伝わってきます。

ねこちゃんたちはみんなかわいいです。
私は、まるたちゃんというベンガルのおんなのこがいちばん大好きです。
にあにゃあさんとまるたちゃんに出会えて、本当にうれしいです。
しあわせをありがとうございます。また、利用させて頂きますね。

reviews.text: Calm, clean and the cat's were well looked after. The staff were friendly too, which was a bonus. There are English rules and explanations. The cats were slightly more social than in other cat cafes I've been to. Spent 40minutes here, well worth it.
A very recent cat cafe, some have said a little bit too expensive - but the cats are all taken care of really well and it's also very clean. The cats are all friendly and very adorable!
I expected a noisy and crowded place, but it was quiet and peaceful. It was great petting the cats as they slept. Very relaxing.
Awesome cats. But wish it wasn't 200 yen for ten minutes. Maybe like a deal for half hour or hour.
Love the place and ambience, very soothing and warm, but the cats seem to avoid me a lot :( Perhaps they are more accustomed to Japanese people.

reviews.text: peaceful and quiet.the cats are so cute and lovely. Its good to take a rest physically and mentally here.
Very comfy place, staff are accommodating most importantly the CATS here are super cute. People respect and enjoy watching them.

Hosts were lovely. Cats were grumpy. Felt lucky that the cats actually chose to sit on our laps for a while. Several people barely got to touch the cats while we were there. But still a cool experience. And still fun.
A very nice and gentle owner who looks after his cats but also makes sure that they get to the customers - but without forcing the cats. Definitely worth a visit.
Cute cats, but they weren't very friendly. Very amenable hosts, cut place. Rather expensive for what you get.

result.adr_address: 5-16 Kurosakichō, Kita-ku, Ōsaka-shi, Ōsaka-fu 530-0023, Japan
result.name: 猫の時間 NEKO NO JIKAN

reviews.text: Very nice place. Some chill kitties, some frisky kitties, some kitties in costume (a fancy collar for Halloween) and a kitty with a cute face that sat on my lap. The kitchen area has free coffee and tea, but the snacks for the cats are 300 Yen if I remember correctly. It is a little meat stick type thing that me and my friend broke up bit by bit and was able to share around.

Tons of extremely chill kitties ready for you to give them scritches. Be sure to buy some cat food once inside, and you will be the hero to all cats. All of these kitties are well cared for and the environment is super nice. Highly recommended!

I've been twice and had two very good experiences. First time I went was on a Saturday and it was pretty busy. They took us up to the fourth floor which from my understanding is only open on the weekends. The second time I was on the main floor. They have a lot of cats, but they have been trained very well and get along with each other well. I was so surprised how calm the cats were and how friendly they were. Sometimes at other cat cafes the cats seem to avoid people at all cost and are generally uninterested in cuddling. On the main floor one of the cats with short legs immediately came to sit in my lap. Upstairs the cat named Blue was super friendly and enjoyed my company. Mid day the cats are mostly sleeping, they wake up around 5 pm when they are fed, so maybe they have more energy that time of day. It is clear that the owners and staff take a lot of time to take care of the cats and they have a strong bond with them. The cats are well cared for, groomed, and extremely soft. The facility is clean and smells good. The admission comes with one drink and is on par with what I would expect.
Over 15 cats in the cafe. Very relax setting to spend time and chill with cats. Unfortunately a couple cats were agreesvie when given treats.
Nekonojikan Second House is more chill than the primary location. And there's an adorable puppy in the café space.

reviews.text: Beautiful cats but they didn't want to be touched, just wanted to snooze. Not as playful as my own cat, spoilt for attention. But beautiful babies none the less.
Gorgeous kitties but only one was friendly. They were mostly very sleepy but still a nice and relaxing place.

È un posto bellissimo per chi adora - come me - i gatti. Li puoi accarezzare, coccolare e dargli da mangiare...sono tutti molto docili e sornioni. Se vuoi puoi bere qualcosa oppure anche no. Da non perdere

千日前の方の猫カフェを利用させて頂きました。スタッフの方が少し冷たいなーと感じました(^^;)遅い時間に行ったので貸切状態でした！成猫が多いからなのかここの猫ちゃんはあまり接客好きではないなと思いました。だからなのか１時間で入ると時間が経つのが遅い気がする（笑）入った瞬間にロシアンブルーの子が肩に飛び乗ってきたのにはビックリ（笑）あと長毛の子が比較的多めな気がする。店内は綺麗で清潔感もあり。毛が硬い子が多くて猫ちゃんストレス溜まってしまってるなとしみじみ。。
千日前店、なんば店、共に開店当時からお世話になっています。(どちらの店舗も20:30pmが最終受付。毎月第３木曜日が定休日。)

result.vicinity: 中央区千日前1-8-8, ミカドビル2階, Osaka

result.name: Neko no Jikan

reviews.text: A very clean and modern place filled with beautiful cats. It might be a bit expensive but you do get a drink with it if you choose to stay longer. There is also a cat-snack dispenser and I highly recommend to buy a few! The cats will flock around you and you really get a chance to be close with them.
It's very relaxing coming here after being in Dotonbori. Just a nice change of pace and the cats are cute. You can buy candy which I recommend

First time visiting this cat cafe. No clear signs for the entry and the staff doesn't speak fluent English which is fine. But she did not explain everything in advance that we need to pay 200¥/10 minutes for using the cats toy. Instead she warned me in front of everyone that we have to pay "now", embarrassing me in front of other guests. First cat cafe in Japan they said but the service is not the most experienced cat cafe. They have 2 munchkins and the remaining are old cats. Thank you for ruining my first cat cafe experience.

Don't waste your time. 12000 yen for an hour and a small drink. I get it that they need to look after the cats but the restrictions are ridiculous. I pulled out a piece of string I found in my bag for the cats to play with and the girl behind the counter came rushing over and insisted I stop.  There were three cats playing with the string at this point so I guess she was worried they might die of having  too much fun. This staff member then ran off to castigate another patron who had the temerity of putting a cat in his lap where it got comfortable and started sleeping.

Cats lethargic, don't wish to play at all. It becomes an hr of boredom and wishing time would run quicker because there's so much more to be doing than watching uninterested cats. You can get snacks for 200/300yen to garner some attention, but once the food is gone the cats lose their interest. Toys are another option but it's 200yen for 10minutes and way too expensive considering the entry fee. 

There are much better cat cafes than this. Spend your money elsewhere.

result.vicinity: 大阪市中央区 西心斎橋2-17-10
